metadata.title: CVE-2021-36047 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
XMP Toolkit SDK version 2020.1 (and earlier) is affected by an ImproperInput Validation vulnerability potentially resulting in arbitrary codeexecution in the context of the current user. Exploitation requires userinteraction in that a victim must open a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36047` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exempi - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
libexempi8 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exempi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1').
